poem:
"Ode to Lily"

Drink of life, become drink of death,
On the ward where shadows grip.
Hushed in sterile air, Lily draws her last breath,
A mournful sip on a tongue grown mute.

In these sterile halls, where minds unravel
And the world cancels its sound,
A soul found life in water's gentle babble,
Only to drown on solid ground.
